sentences.english: We should abandon all outmoded conventions and customs to keep pace with new era.
sentences.chinese: 我们要抛弃陈规陋习以跟上新时代的步伐。

sentences.english: She boldly criticised the out-dated customs.
A person with a high self-esteem values herself and will not get into, or stay in, an abusive relationship.
sentences.chinese: 一个自重的人会监督自己，不会让自己有陋习。

sentences.english: Spitting was mostly associated with smoking, both denounced by women as bad habits.
sentences.chinese: 吐痰大多与吸烟有关，二者都被妇女斥为陋习。

sentences.english: Outdated conventions and bad customs hamper the growth of production.
sentences.chinese: 陈规陋习妨碍生产的发展。

sentences.english: The self-inquiry worked relentlessly to expose my conditioned behavior and hypocrisy.
sentences.chinese: 自我探索无情地暴露出我的陋习和虚伪。

sentences.english: Therefore, some bid habits is just our prejudice.
sentences.chinese: 所以说，有些陋习，只是我们的“陋见”而已。
我们都有我们自己的陋习。

sentences.english: We should certainly get rid of the evil traditions and customs.
sentences.chinese: 我们理所当然地要革除恶俗陋习。

sentences.english: They also opposed the feudal vulgar customs, and initiatived positive new healthy social atmosphere.
sentences.chinese: 她们还反对封建陋习，倡导积极健康的社会新风气。

sentences.english: Prosperity doth best discover vice , but adversity doth best discover virtue.
sentences.chinese: 顺境时显陋习，逆境时见美德。

definition: noxious winds, evil influences (idiom); malignant social trends
old habits are hard to change (idiom)
